thinking.disposable_income: Alief has a median household income of around $46,000, which is below Houston's average, with approximately 18% of residents living below the poverty line.
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Given the lower income levels and high proportion of working-class families, residents have limited discretionary spending capacity and are price-sensitive to transportation costs.
thinking.accessibility: Alief is heavily car-dependent with limited public transit options, though it has some bus routes connecting to major employment centers, and about 15% of households don't own vehicles.
thinking.decision_rationale: 1) Prioritized proposals with lower transit fares ($0.75) to help transit-dependent residents and encourage transit use. 2) Favored moderate tax rates (1%) to balance service improvements with household budget impacts. 3) Supported moderate driving fees ($0.50) to fund transit while not overly burdening car-dependent residents. 4) Selected proposals that achieve significant transit time improvements while keeping costs manageable. 5) Considered the large immigrant population and working-class nature of the neighborhood in balancing costs versus benefits.
